intro: Cogswellia foeniculacea, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are usually covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss in its dry environment. Cogswellia foeniculacea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
